member.name: T:SFGraphics.Cameras.Camera
member.summary:
A container for 4x4 camera matrices. The matrices can not be set directly. To edit the translation matrix, the camera position should be changed, for example.
Keyboard/mouse controls can be added by inheriting from this class and using the Pan(), Rotate(), Zoom() methods.

member.name: P:SFGraphics.Cameras.Camera.Position
member.summary: The position of the camera in scene units. Updates all matrices when set.

member.name: P:SFGraphics.Cameras.Camera.FovRadians
member.summary:
The vertical field of view in radians. Updates and all matrices when set.
Values less than or equal to 0 or greater than or equal to PI are ignored.

member.name: P:SFGraphics.Cameras.Camera.FovDegrees
member.summary:
The vertical field of view in degrees. Updates and all matrices when set.
Values less than or equal to 0 or greater than or equal to 180 are ignored.

member.name: P:SFGraphics.Cameras.Camera.RotationXRadians
member.summary: The rotation around the x-axis in radians. Updates and all matrices when set.

member.name: P:SFGraphics.Cameras.Camera.RotationXDegrees
member.summary: The rotation around the x-axis in degrees. Updates and all matrices when set.

member.name: P:SFGraphics.Cameras.Camera.RotationYRadians
member.summary: The rotation around the y-axis in radians. Updates all matrices when set.

member.name: P:SFGraphics.Cameras.Camera.RotationYDegrees
member.summary: The rotation around the y-axis in degrees. Updates all matrices when set.

member.name: P:SFGraphics.Cameras.Camera.FarClipPlane
member.summary: The far clip plane of the perspective matrix. Updates all matrices when set.

member.name: P:SFGraphics.Cameras.Camera.NearClipPlane
member.summary: The near clip plane of the perspective matrix. Updates all matrices when set.

member.name: T:SFGraphics.GLObjects.BufferObject
member.summary: Encapsulates an OpenGL buffer object. Like other GLOBjects, memory is handled by GLObjectManager.

member.summary: The value generated by GL.GenBuffer(). Do not attempt to bind this when the object has gone out of scope.

member.name: P:SFGraphics.GLObjects.BufferObject.BufferTarget
member.summary: The target to which the buffer is bound when calling Bind().

member.summary: Creates and binds an empty buffer of the specified target.

member.name: M:SFGraphics.GLObjects.BufferObject.Finalize
member.summary: Decrement the reference count for this ID. The context probably isn't current, so the data is deleted later by GLObjectManager.

member.name: M:SFGraphics.GLObjects.BufferObject.Bind
member.summary: Binds the buffer to the target specified at creation.

member.summary: Generates a framebuffer with a color attachment of the specified pixel format and dimensions. A render buffer of the same dimensions as the color attachment is generated for the depth component. Binds the framebuffer.

member.name: M:SFGraphics.GLObjects.Framebuffer.Bind

member.name: T:SFGraphics.GLObjects.GLObjectManager
member.summary:
Manages reference counting and resource management for all GLObjects. Each GLObject has an ID generated by OpenTK. When an object is created, the reference count for that ID is incremented. When the finalizer is called for an object, the reference count is decremented. will maintain reference counts for any class inheriting from or .
Call with a valid OpenTK context current to delete objects with no references. The reference count is managed automatically, so there is no need to call GL.DeleteTexture(int), for example.

member.name: M:SFGraphics.GLObjects.GLObjectManager.DeleteUnusedGLObjects
member.summary:
The appropriate GL.Delete() function is called for all GLObjects if the ID has 0 references. This means GLObjects may not be cleaned up until long after the original object becomes unreachable.
Call prior to if more immediate cleanup is desired.

member.name: P:SFGraphics.GLObjects.IGLObject.Id
member.summary: The value generated by GL.Gen() for a texture, buffer, etc. Do not attempt to bind this when the object has gone out of scope.

member.name: T:SFGraphics.GLObjects.Shaders.Shader
member.summary:
Encapsulates a shader program and attached shaders. Errors are stored to an internal log, which can be exported with .
Ensure that returns true before rendering to avoid crashes.

member.name: P:SFGraphics.GLObjects.Shaders.Shader.Id

member.name: M:SFGraphics.GLObjects.Shaders.Shader.Finalize

member.name: M:SFGraphics.GLObjects.Shaders.Shader.GetVertexAttributeUniformLocation(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the index of the vertex attribute or uniform variable. Returns -1 if not found.
member.param: The name of the vertex attribute or uniform
member.returns: The index of the attribute/uniform or -1 if not found

member.name: M:SFGraphics.GLObjects.Shaders.Shader.EnableVertexAttributes
member.summary: Enables the vertex attribute arrays for all active attributes. Ensures that extra attributes aren't enabled, which causes crashes on Geforce drivers.

member.name: M:SFGraphics.GLObjects.Shaders.Shader.DisableVertexAttributes
member.summary: Disables the vertex attribute arrays for all active attributes. Ensures that extra attributes aren't enabled, which causes crashes on Geforce drivers.

member.name: M:SFGraphics.GLObjects.Shaders.Shader.GetErrorLog
member.summary: Gets the error log containing hardware info, version number, compilation/linker errors, and attempts to initialize invalid uniform or vertex attribute names.
member.returns: A String of all detected errors

member.name: M:SFGraphics.GLObjects.Shaders.Shader.LoadShader(System.String)
member.summary: Reads the specified text file and attempts to compile and attach the shader. Supported shader types are fragment (.frag), vertex (.vert), and geometry (.geom).
member.param: The path to a shader text file. The loaded shader type is based on the file extension.

member.name: M:SFGraphics.GLObjects.Shaders.Shader.ProgramCreatedSuccessfully
member.summary:
Returns true when the link status is ok and all attached shaders compiled. If false, rendering with this shader will most likely cause a crash.
The status is only updated the first time is called, so there is little cost in checking this method frequently.

member.name: T:SFGraphics.GLObjects.Shaders.ShaderLog
member.summary: Stores hardware info, OpenGL/GLSL version, invalid uniform/attribute names, shader compilation errors, and linker errors.

member.name: T:SFGraphics.GLObjects.Textures.Texture
member.summary:
Encapsulates the state for an OpenGL texture object. To support texture types other than and , inherit from this class and add the necessary additional methods.
Avoid creating textures manually to prevent issues with textures being deleted by .

member.summary: Calculates a visually similar RGB color to a blackbody.

Values higher than max are clamped to max.

Values lower than min are clamped to min.

The vector to normalize against

member.name: M:SFGraphics.Tools.VectorTools.GenerateTangentBitangent(OpenTK.Vector3,OpenTK.Vector3,OpenTK.Vector3,OpenTK.Vector2,OpenTK.Vector2,OpenTK.Vector2,OpenTK.Vector3@,OpenTK.Vector3@)
member.summary:
Generates a tangent vector and a bitangent vector for a triangle face.
and should be added to the existing tangent and bitangent value for each vertex in the triangle. Normalizing the final sum averages the tangents and bitangents for smoother results.
member.param: The position of the first vertex
The position of the second vertex
The position of the third vertex
The UV coordinates of the first vertex
The UV coordinates of the second vertex
The UV coordinates of the third vertex
The generated tangent vector
The generated bitangent vector

member.name: M:SFGraphics.Tools.VectorTools.CalculateNormal(OpenTK.Vector3,OpenTK.Vector3,OpenTK.Vector3)
member.summary: Calculates the face normal of a triangle. The result is not normalized.
member.param: The position of the first vertex
The position of the second vertex
The position of the third vertex
